div.sent: Gradually the light of the sun spreads all around us.
As the light spreads, birds start singing sweetly.
Children get ready for school and others for their work.
Thus we all get ready for our daily work.
The sun also starts its work then.
It gives us light for about 12 hours a day.
We call this period a day.
The sun gradually sets in the west.
Thus the day ends.
Darkness covers all around.
This time is called a night.
We cannot see anything in the darkness of night.
So, we use lamps.
Sometimes we have questions in our mind: Why is there no light for all times?
Who has created light?
Where does this darkness come from?
Can mankind create light and darkness?
Who is the creator of all these things?
He, who has made these things, is the Creator or God.
He created all these within six days only.
He created light on the first day.
On the second day He created the sky.
God needed nothing to create all these.
He created everything with his words.
Now we will try to know how God has created the light and the sky.
Creation of the Light and the Sky God existed before everything.
There was nothing except Him.
Darkness was all around.
God said, Let there be light and there was light everywhere.
God saw the light.
He was delighted.
He became very happy.
Thus His creation of the first day ended.
Then there was no sky.
God said, Let there be the sky and at once there was the sky.
God became very happy and thus ended His creation of the second day.
When we look up in an open field, we see the blue sky above.
It seems that the sky has touched the earth far away.
How up is the sky?
Is the sky a roof on us?
In fact, we don't know the right answers.
In the sky we see the sun, the moon, the stars and the floating clouds.
Sometimes there are storms and rain.
Aren't we surprised when we see all these?
We realise that no human being can create these.
God is the creator of everything.
We love to have new dresses, shoes, etc.
We thank the person who gives us gifts.
We also praise him or her and find pleasure to speak about it.
This is admiration.
Everyday we get benefits from them in some way or other.
O God, I thank You very much for Your gracious light and the sky.
Please help me so that I can remain bright and innocent like Your light.
Let me love You all the time.
